fields.description:
h2. Problem:
Currently, the Jira Migration Assistant does not support the migration of custom priority icons, when moving from Server -> Cloud all of our icons are missing.

Customers are required to upload the images manually. Following our docs [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upload-custom-priority-icons-in-jira-788961156.html].

h2. Suggestion:
Have the migration assistant automatically upload priority icons to the new cloud site.
fields.summary: Support migration of custom priority icons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating Confluence from server to Cloud, and using the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, the global templates will not get migrated as they are part of the global settings and since essentially this is a space migration, it's expected that the global templates don't get migrated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Confluence Server
# Create Global Templates
# Migrate the spaces and users to the Cloud
# Check the global template section in the Cloud.

h3. Expected Results

The Global Templates would get migrated.

h3. Actual Results

The Global Templates do not get migrated.

h3. Workaround

1. Install on your Confluence Cloud one of these two apps:

[Source Editor for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215664/source-editor-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview%5D] OR [Page Source Editor for Confluence Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220772/page-source-editor-for-confluence-cloud]

2. Copy the Storage Format (source code) of the Global Template from Confluence Server.
3. Paste the codes into a Confluence Cloud page via the Source Editor plugin.
4. In a new tab open that global template.
5. While both pages are in edit mode, copy the contents from the new page in Step 3 into the global template.

If you need assistance executing this workaround, please, reach out to [support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/].

*Note:* Keep in mind that if you have any macros or other features that are only available for Confluence Server, the template will not work in Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Consider making the Confluence Assistant migrating Global Templates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If some of the {{MIG_}} tables already exists, but not all of them, the migration assistant won't create the missing tables and will fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla instance of _Confluence_ -- tested with version *7.3.3*.
 # Upgrade _Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant_ to the latest version available -- tested with version *2.6.0*.
 # Drop some tables from the database as suggested below; I couldn't determine the trigger on why just some of the tables existed.
{code}
drop table mig_step;
drop table mig_analytics_event;
drop table mig_task;
drop table mig_check_result;
drop table mig_app_assessment_info;
drop table mig_detected_event_log;
drop table mig_attachment;
drop table mig_plan;
drop table mig_work_item;
drop table mig_sequences;
drop table mig_stats;
{code}
 # Access the _Migration Assistant_ page.

The App identifies the missing tables and manages to restart in a clean state, creating the necessary tables and cleaning the ones that existed.

h3. Workaround
The current workaround is to drop all the tables related to the Migration Assistant App following the procedure below.

# Run the following queries in the database to drop all tables related to the migration App -- use this order.
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the customer tries to migrate Projects from Jira server to Jira Prod cloud site using Jira Migration Assistant, Project migration fails with an Error. However, no error was thrown during the previous Test migration attempt to a different site. 
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Not applicable for all the migration scenarios. 
 # The basic step to rep-produce is to migrate the project from Server to Cloud using Jira Migration Assistance. 

h3. Expected Results

Not Applicable
h3. Actual Results

Not Applicable

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2020-05-06 19:54:51,679+0100 pool-10-thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.m.tracking.polling.StatusPoller] Migration aaaaaaa-12345-67890-bbbbb-cccceeee completed, Migration errors: projectDataUpload#ABC: java.lang.IllegalStateException: More than one migrated file found for attachment 111111 (StackTrace=java.lang.IllegalStateException: More than one migrated file found for attachment 111111
    	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.migration.MigratedFileRepository.findMigration(MigratedFileRepository.kt:69)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.workers.AttachmentMediaIdService$generateAttachmentMediaIdsForProject$2.invoke(AttachmentMediaIdService.kt:43)
    	at 
{noformat}
{code:java}
More than one migrated file found for attachment XXXX
{code}
 *Cause of the issue:*
 # In the plugin, we upload attachments using a MediaID the plugin receives from the Media API in the cloud.
 # This MediaID is paired with the attachments and stored in the DB.
 # It is possible that the *main site* and the *sandbox* use the same MediaID.
 # i.e. the first migration to the *sandbox* is successful, but not the second migration to the *main* *site* because of the *conflicting MediaID*.
 # Therefore, truncating the DB will resolve the issue as it will remove the conflicts.

h3. Workaround

Please do *reach out to the Atlassian support* to confirm if you should *Delete or truncate* the table.  The workaround is to delete or truncate the *AO_6FF49D_MIGRATED_FILE* table prior to migrating to the production site. This can be done using either of the SQL below:
{code:java}
DELETE FROM AO_6FF49D_MIGRATED_FILE
// or
TRUNCATE TABLE AO_6FF49D_MIGRATED_FILE {code}
fields.summary: Jira Migration Assistant fails with "More than one migrated file found for attachment XXXX"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant to migrate the projects and there's a project stuck in the import, please *DO NOT* do anything (or delete the plan from database).

This is because deleting the plan from the Server will not stop the import process on Cloud. Thus, the new plan will not be processed while the old plan (on Cloud) is still running.
 * Atlassian support has to be reached and support will have to escalate the ticket to Dev so that they can kill the import process on their end.

h3. Workaround
 * Allow customers to kill the import from the plugin itself.
fields.summary: A feature to stop a migration that has been triggered from the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when using JCMA all fields(and other entities) migrated by the add-on have a description added with the date they were migrated:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-15 at 14.16.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Grant users the option to chose whether they want to have this description added or not.
fields.summary: Give users the option to remove the migrated text from fields.

fields.description:
When using the App Assessment feature in CCMA it results with how many pages include a certain add-on.

Example: Gliffy is found on 50 pages.

The customer would like to be able to drill down and see a list of the 50 pages that are using the add-on/macro.

Current Behavior: The app assessment simply lists the number of pages, no link to drill down.

Current Workaround: https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/macros-139387.html#Macros-Macrousagestatistics

Expected Behavior: When the app assessment lists '50 pages', that would be directly linked to the macro usage statistics (new tab) as shared above so they can start drilling down without having to run separate queries.

Ideally, something similar would be available for JCMA.
fields.summary: Link Usage in App Assessment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating users using the Jira Migration Assistant, users marked as inactive in Jira Server are brought over with site access.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user in Server
 # Disable the user
 # Migrate the user using JCMA
 # The user will have site access

*Jira Server Settings*
 !image-2020-05-12-18-24-34-269.png|width=405,height=258!

*Jira Cloud Settings*
 !image-2020-05-12-18-24-39-522.png|width=403,height=262!
h3. Expected Results

The user should realistically respect the Jira Server settings by migrating the user -as inactive, or- without site access

Note: In Atlassian Cloud, users are always active. The equivalent of inactive Server user is a Cloud user (active) who does not have product access.
h3. Actual Results

The respective user will have site access in Cloud
h3. Workaround

Disable the user via the user interface or reach out to support for other options of bulk disabling users.
fields.summary: Jira Migration Assistant should respect "Active" status from Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Migration Assistant fails with no log available.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * The Media ID generation during project export is taking too long.

 * As a result, MO times out the task and fails the migration.

 * The task completes eventually, but when it sends an update to MO, 409 is returned.

h3. Expected Results

The migration completed properly.
h3. Actual Results
{code:java}
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.migration.httpclient.exceptions.UnexpectedStatusCodeException: Received an unexpected status code; expected [200], but received 409: {"timestamp":"2020-05-08T22:34:05.572+0000","path":"/api/plugin/migrations/d48777e2-a50f-4489-a733-2439f49a9d28/tasks/projectDataUpload%23RC$94e2f52a343932ae57968ad22a22986e79b3a83287cbac466473ea35dd98690a/statusUpdate","status":409,"error":"Conflict","message":"The provided task token hash xxxxx is invalid or expired","requestId":"xxxxx-154332"}{code}
h3. Workaround
 * Potentially Retry migration. However, this does not always work.
fields.summary: Generating Media IDs during project export is taking too long

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Server instances that have many invalid users (~ 1000) may experience a very long loading time with the spinner continuously spinning and then (in google chrome) the browser tab crashing
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This can be reproduced for Confluence Server instances with very large sets of invalid emails when viewing the Check For Errors page.
h3. Expected Results

User validation preflight checks successfully load and display correctly
h3. Actual Results

User validation preflight checks may take a long time to load and potentially crash (or force refresh for IE) the browser tab.
h3. Workaround

Current workaround is to disable the user validation preflight checks using the following dark feature flags

*migration-assistant.disable.invalid-emails-check*
 *migration-assistant.disable.duplicate-emails-check*
fields.summary: Preflight checks failing to load for lots of invalid emails

fields.description:
Currently, there is no option to create and submit a migration plan without performing a full test migration.

It would be great if the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant will have an option to validate the migration plan changes, an option to save and run the migration plan, but without a commit on the changes and the option to export a file with all the changes that plan will perform on the cloud site.
fields.summary: Support validation mode for Jira Cloud Migration Assistant
JCMA should validate JQL filters for validity pre-migration

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Document what conditions allow the "Run" option to be used in JCMA. The option seems to be greyed out in multiple conditions that should allow a re-run (e.g. when a pre-check fails and the migration is saved)

!image-2020-05-05-18-38-32-299.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Document what conditions allow the "Run" option to be used in JCMA

fields.description:
h2. Summary
As stated in [Advanced search reference - JQL fields|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-search-reference-jql-fields/], the equal sign is not a valid operator for Text fields. However, Server does support it sometimes. If JCMA encounters a filter using an unsupported operator, it will fail the entire migration. Example below works in Server but doesn't work in Cloud:
{code}
textFieldName="EMPTY"
{code}

h2. Suggestion
To enhance Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA) so it doesn't fail the entire migration in case the such condition is met.

h2. Current Scenario
JCMA will throw the following error on logs and fail the entire migration when attempting to migrate a Filter that has an unsupported operator:
{code}
2020-04-09 04:59:52.668 ERROR TESTPROJECT project-import We couldn't import Board 'XXX'. Reason: query: The operator '=' is not supported by the 'YYY' field..
{code}

h2. Expected Scenario(s)
* Administrators are presented with a message in the migration plan (or in the logs) stating which filters to adjust before migrating.
* Administrators can run the entire migration without these filters and then manually re-create them in the Cloud.
* Administrators can migrate all filters regardless, they wouldn't work in Cloud though until manually adjusted.
 
h2. Workaround
To manually review all filters in the instance and ensure they do comply with what's listed in [Advanced search reference - JQL fields|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-search-reference-jql-fields/].
fields.summary: Report filters using unsupported operators instead of failing the entire migration

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The [What gets migrated with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html] documentation has a section called *What isn't migrated* pointing out that *Select List (multiple choice) Custom Fields* doesn't get migrated. These type of fields are widely leveraged in Server environments.

h2. Suggestion
To enhance Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA) so it does migrate such custom fields or to avoid failing the entire migration in case the tool run across any of these.

h2. Current Scenario
JCMA will throw the following error on logs and fail the entire migration when attempting to migrate a Board that has a Select List (multiple choice) Custom Field:
{code}
2020-04-10 21:40:26.474 ERROR TESTPROJECT project-import We couldn't import Board 'XXX'. Reason: query: The option 'YYY' for field 'ZZZ' does not exist..
{code}

h2. Expected Scenario(s)
* Administrators are presented with a message in the migration plan (or in the logs) stating which boards/projects to remove the Custom Field from before migrating.
* Administrators can migrate all boards/projects without their Custom Fields.
* Administrators can migrate all boards/projects with their Custom Fields. 
 
h2. Workaround
So the entire migration doesn't fail, identify these Custom Fields before hand and manually re-create them on Cloud before the migration runs. The migration won't fail, but data related to this Custom Field won't be migrated either. At the end, one would still need to use CSV Import to import the data behind these specific fields to Cloud.
fields.summary: Migrate Select List (multiple choice) Custom Fields

fields.description:
h2. Update: Please head over to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-169 to vote and comment for this feature.
h2. Summary

The [What gets migrated with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html] documentation has a section called *What isn't migrated* pointing out that *Cross-project boards* doesn't get migrated. As stated in [How do I get a board to point to multiple projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-resources/jira-agile-faq/how-do-i-get-a-board-to-point-to-multiple-projects], it is possible to make a board available cross-project, which is widely leveraged in Server environments.
h2. Suggestion

To enhance Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA) so it does migrate cross-project boards or to have a validation rule that states to administrators which boards will need to be manually re-created in Cloud once the migration is completed.
h2. Current Scenario

Administrators have no visibility to which boards will not get migrated until they migrate and start to notice missing data in Cloud. This is not a reliable process.
h2. Expected Scenario(s)
 * Administrators are presented with a message in the migration plan (or in the logs) stating which boards are not migrated.
 * Administrators can select one project to tie the board(s) and get them migrated.
 * Administrators can migrate all boards regardless.
fields.summary: Migrate boards connected to multiple projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira migrations may fail due to invalid references in JQL filters associated with boards. One such examples is caused by https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15353 

One example of this is a deleted version:
{code:java}
2020-04-30 22:36:07.910 ERROR CCMP project-import We couldn't import Board 'CCM Product Team board'. Reason: query: The value '2.2' does not exist for the field 'fixversion'.. This caused 904 other items to fail.{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Software Project
 # Create a version and associate some issues with it
 # Create a filter using this version and associate it with a Project Board
 # Delete the version
 # Try to migrate this board

h3. Expected Results

JCMA handles the invalid reference in a better way, perhaps allowing the admin to edit the filter on the fly before migrating.
h3. Actual Results

The migrartion fails:
{code:java}
2020-04-30 22:36:07.910 ERROR CCMP project-import We couldn't import Board 'CCM Product Team board'. Reason: query: The value '2.2' does not exist for the field 'fixversion'.. This caused 904 other items to fail.{code}
h3. Workaround

Manually ensure the board and filter is valid before migrating.
fields.summary: JCMA should handle filter and board dependencies in a better way

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence app vendors with DC compatible apps should decide how they choose to make their apps [compatible with read only mode|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/how-to-make-your-add-on-compatible-with-read-only-mode/]. This may be to disable the functionality of an app in read only mode so that an admin does not have to contend with an app writing data to the database.

In the case of CCMA, read only mode is often used by admins during a Server > Cloud migration, so CCMA should be fully functional during read only mode and continue to work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Be running Confluence Data Center - (add a DC license to Confluence Server)
 # Put Confluence into read only mode - [link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-read-only-mode-for-site-maintenance-952624304.html]
 # Start using CCMA

h3. Expected Results

CCMA continues to work as usual
h3. Actual Results

CCMA is not functional
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: When Confluence DC is in read only mode, CCMA does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you got your user's imported by support in the last 10 days and you did a Jira site import and as a result, all your content in Jira is showing as "User" you might have been affected by this bug.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have support importing your users
# Import Jira database through Jira site import using the merge option.

h3. Expected Results

All the users would sync properly

h3. Actual Results

All content associations to the users are broken.

h3. Workaround

Contact support - https://support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: User content association wide problems in Jira site import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Cloud Migration assistant fails to migrate users properly between default groups "confluence-administrators" in Server to the "administrators" group in Cloud. Confluence Server uses the default group "confluence-administrators" whereas Confluence Cloud uses "administrators".

When using CCMA, migrated permissions in Cloud do not show confluence-administrators group, but rather administrators(expected). However, the users from the Confluence Server "*confluence-administrators"* group are not migrated to the "*administrators*" group in Cloud, causing loss of permission. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Confluence Server and create a new user e.g. test@test.com
 # Add this user to confluence-administrators group
 # Create a space called e.g. Test Space
 # Add confluence-administrators to the Test Space admin panel
 # Use CCMA to migrate this space

h3. Actual Results

Since the +default groups+ are different between platforms, the Test Space permissions in Cloud do not show confluence-administrators group, but rather administrators. However, the users from the Confluence Server "*confluence-administrators"* group are not migrated to the "*administrators*" group in Cloud, causing loss of permission. 

Example Space in Server:
 !serverperms.png|thumbnail! 

Same Space in Cloud after CCMA:
 !cloudperms.png|thumbnail! 

Since the original confluence-administrators group is not getting added to the space permissions, permissions are lost for anyone who had access as part of that group in server. 

h3. Expected Results

The users from the Confluence Server "*confluence-administrators*" group are properly migrated to the "*administrators*" group in Cloud so that permissions are kept. 
h3. Workaround

Add the *confluence-administrators* group to space permissions. 

Alternatively, move everyone that used to be in Confluence Server’s *confluence-administrators* group to the Cloud’s *administrators* group, taking into account the cross-product effect outlined [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/create-and-update-groups-744721627.html].
fields.summary: Cloud Migration assistant fails to migrate users properly between default groups confluence-administrators in Server to administrators in Cloud

fields.description:
*Problem:*
Currently, the Jira migration assistance doesn't support Cross-project boards migration


*Suggestions:*
It would be great if the Migration assistance could migrate the Cross-project boards as well. These are often used by end-users and can only be migrated by manually re-creating them that will involve a lot of manual work.
fields.summary: Support Cross-project boards migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments are failing to display for migrated Confluence space. Thumbnails are not loading on Confluence pages but the attachments will load from the 'Attachments' page fine.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate Confluence space from Server to Cloud using Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
 # View migrated Confluence space in Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

Page loads properly displaying all attachments
h3. Actual Results

Some attachments fail to be displayed even though they are present on the Cloud instance
 Logs show:
{code:java}
2020-04-27 18:08:35.307	WARN	com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.RedirectToFileStoreDownload	Failed to obtain thumbnail for attachment 298871 (processing status: FAILED). Sending redirect to the original image.{code}
h3. Workaround
* You can access and view the attachments by clicking on '...' at the top right and selecting 'Attachments' to load a list of all attachments on the page.
OR
*  If there are multiple pages affected, please contact Atlassian Migration Support team and ask to apply a workaround for this issue, the migration support team can apply this workaround on your cloud site.
fields.summary: Attachments not loading after Confluence migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Content Reindexing is not available the UI but needs to be run after a migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Perform a Confluence migration
 
h3. Expected Results
* Content is reindexed automatically and all searches and other functionality dependent on the indexing works fine.

h3. Actual Results
* Reindexing needs to be run multiple times after a S -> C migration. 

h3. Workaround
* Request support to run a content reindex as this option isn't available in the UI for end users.
fields.summary: Reindexing is not available the UI but needs to be run after a migration

fields.description:
h3. (x) Issue Summary

When trying to use [Jira Migration assistance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/use-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud-993925215.html], It fails to migrate a few projects.
h3. (i) Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Migration assistance on your Jira Server
 # Select your project and migrate to your destination cloud site.

h3. (+) Expected Results
 * Project Migrated Successfully to the cloud.

h3. (on) Actual Results
 * Project migration incomplete.

The below *Error thrown in the error.log* file:
{noformat}
2020-04-07 00:00:00.001 ERROR AAA project-import We couldn't import Issue AAA-1234. Reason: IllegalArgumentException: Error occurred while converting time estimates: Durations must be in whole minutes. This caused 7 other items to fail.
{noformat}
h3. (/) Workaround
 - When you *navigate to the issue id(AAA-1234)* as shown in the error.log, you can see that the *time estimate is seen in decimal like 0.01d*
 - The occurs when the time *tracking feature is changed on the Jira Server*. To resolve this *follow the below steps*:
 ## Navigate to *"Settings -> Issues -> Issue Features -> Time Tracking"* in your Jira instance
 ## You need to click the *"Deactivate" button* to edit the time tracking feature.
 ## Set the *estimate display format to "pretty"* and see how the Jira Server UI displays the estimate now for the issue, *it should be displayed as the whole number like* 5m or 1d or 2w.

If you still face any issue, please reach out to Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Migration using Jira Migration Assistance fails with "Error occurred while converting time estimates"

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:*

Currently, the Jira Migration Assistant doesn't support migration of dashboards, as per [What gets migrated with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html].
h3. *Suggestions:*

It would be great if the Jira Migration Assistant could migrate the dashboards as well from Server to cloud. .
fields.summary: Support Migration of Dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, if [some entities already exist in the cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/how-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-links-your-data-993925217.html], JCMA gets a request to recreate the entity and duplicates the entity as *(migrated)*.

It's pretty common for admins to then evaluate and delete the duplicate entities. However, there are some references to these deleted/merged entities that may cause future JCMA migrations to fail.
h3. Suggested Approach

We should have better handling of these scenarios:

1) How duplicate elements are created/managed by JCMA
 2) Better manage future JCMA migrations for missing dependencies on these elements
fields.summary: Better handling of deleted objects with Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Whether you have a user without email or you exceed your license seat limit in the Cloud the error message stated doesn't help identify the problem:

Error importing data: cloud.atlassian.logmon.laas.api.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersImportService$WrappingCrowdException
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

Log the exact problem or at least give a hint of the issue the customer is facing. Replace the generic error message.

As there is no way for a customer to access the backend logs, you will need to reach out to [Cloud support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com]
Alternatively, users can refer to the following KB:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There might be several different reasons for the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant to be unable to check for the space key conflict, however, if you see the following logs on your server the problem might be the authorization has expired and you need to re-link your Server to your Cloud site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan to migrate a space
# Wait for a few days
# Try to run that same plan again.

h3. Expected Results

The plan would migrate the space

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the Atlassian-confluence.log file:

{noformat}
ERROR [Caesium-1-1] [service.check.space.SpaceConflictChecker] error Error executing space keys conflict check.
– checkExecutionId: xxxxxxxxxxxx
com.atlassian.migration.agent.okhttp.HttpServiceException: Bad request. Status code: 401, message: {"code":401,"message":"Unauthorized"}
.....
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

You can try to re-link your Cloud site to your Server, usually, that will solve the problem if not try [Restore the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence to its default version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/restore-the-cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-to-the-default-version-974378747.html], note that will wipe all your previous plans, it's also worth checking for any network appliances that could be blocking traffic and white list [Atlassian's Cloud IP's and Domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html].

[Reach out to support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com] if you continue to have this problem after going through the workaround above.

*Re-link your server to Cloud*

- Create a new plan in JCMA/CCMA.
- When you advance to the next screen, click on "Choose Cloud Site" JCMA/CCMA will redirect you to the Cloud.
- A drop-down menu will appear so you can select the Cloud site.
- You should be able to proceed with the migration.
fields.summary: Error executing space keys conflict check

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant on Windows, if a project being migrated has a ProjectKey that matches the following Windows filename reserved list, then the migration will fail.



CON, PRN, AUX, NUL, COM1, COM2, COM3, COM4, COM5, COM6, COM7, COM8, COM9, LPT1, LPT2, LPT3, LPT4, LPT5, LPT6, LPT7, LPT8, and LPT9
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to migrate a Project on Windows whose ProjectKey is one of the above values
 # The migration will fail with the below error

h3. Expected Results

Migration should be successful
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
java.nio.file.FileSystemException: C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA\export\migration-to-cloud[MIGRATION-ID]\projects\[PROJECT-KEY].json: The parameter is incorrect.
at sun.nio.fs.WindowsException.translateToIOException(WindowsException.java:86)
at sun.nio.fs.WindowsException.rethrowAsIOException(WindowsException.java:97)
at sun.nio.fs.WindowsException.rethrowAsIOException(WindowsException.java:102)
at sun.nio.fs.WindowsFileSystemProvider.implDelete(WindowsFileSystemProvider.java:269)
at sun.nio.fs.AbstractFileSystemProvider.deleteIfExists(AbstractFileSystemProvider.java:108)
at java.nio.file.Files.deleteIfExists(Files.java:1165)
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.common.LocalFileDataOutput.outputFileForProjectData(LocalFileDataOutput.kt:29)
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.ExportFacade.exportProject(ExportFacade.kt:58)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Rename the Project Key to another value
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Assistant fails with "java.nio.file.FileSystemException: XXXXX. The parameter is incorrect" on Windows when ProjectKey uses a Windows reserved filename

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attempting to migrate Jira projects and boards using the JCMA tool, the project fails with an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# This could happen if in the past the issuetype/priority existed for that project and a card color was configured for it.
# This could also happen if the board uses a filter that spans multiple projects, and the other project has different issue types/priorities. Once an issue of a different type appears in the board, a colour would be automatically configured for that issue type/priority, which could cause this issue.

h3. Expected Results
Flagged in pre-migration check

h3. Actual Results
Exception is thrown.
{noformat}
ERROR {{XXX project}}-export Board 'MyBoardName' refers to card colors with missing references. Missing references are: Issue Type {}. Remove the colors to resolve this issue.
{noformat}
OR
{noformat}
ERROR {{XXX project}}-export Board 'MyBoardName' refers to card colors with missing references. Missing references are: Priority {}. Remove the colors to resolve this issue.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Go to Board configuration, then go into Card Color, then remove the affected Issuetype/priorities
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Assistant project export fails with "Board 'XXXX' refers to card colors with missing references."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Export of jira project fails in Jira Cloud Migration Assistant due to XXXX has no screen configured for default issue operation
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a screen for default issue operation for a screen scheme.
 # Somehow delete screen scheme configuration mapping
 # Attempt to use JCMA to export project

h3. Expected Results

Migration of project and entities succeeds
h3. Actual Results

Project export fails with error:
{noformat}
We couldn't export Screen Scheme '{XXXX}'. Reason: XXXX has no screen configured for default issue operation{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually configure a default screen scheme for that project

OR

run SQL on affected scheme.
{noformat}
select * from "FIELDSCREENSCHEMEITEM" where fieldscreenscheme= {insert broken scheme id}
{noformat}
Update the operation column to be null for this record
{noformat}
update FIELDSCREENSCHEMEITEM set operation=null where id={scheme id}{noformat}
Restart Jira (this is needed because Jira caches the DB values and directly updating DB table will not trigger the cache to be updated)

Please check in UI and see if the corresponding issue operation column in the configuration page has changed Default or not.

UI: Jira Administration -> issues -> Screen Schemes -> configure button on 'Risk screen scheme' entry

If yes, please try run another migration and the error should be gone.
fields.summary: We couldn't export Screen Scheme '{XXXX}'. Reason: XXXX has no screen configured for default issue operation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When migrating projects using JCMA, plans are being marked as "Incomplete" due to missing permissions in destination site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to use JCMA to migrate some projects associated to permission scheme with Service Desk Agent


h3. Expected Results
This should be flagged in the pre-migration check stage or migrated successfully when JSD project migrations are supported.

h3. Actual Results
The migration is marked incomplete and an error message is shown:_ IllegalArgumentException: Project permission [SERVICEDESK_AGENT] does not exist]_ 

h3. Workaround
Install Jira Service Desk on the destination cloud site and re-run the migration. No permissions need to be given to users.

If this does not work, please contact support.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Assistant ends migration as "Incomplete" due to missing permission "Service Desk Agent"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customers are unable to perform migrations as the plugin is frozen in maintenance mode even though this is not the case.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Jira Cloud Migration Assistant
 # Authentication flow fails between the migration service and Jira
 # Maintenance window message is displayed

h3. Expected Results
Accurate error message is displayed indicating failed auth and a prompt for the user to retry.

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-07 at 8.51.55 am.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Relink destination cloud site in Jira Cloud Migration Assistant to get a new token. If this doesn't work, please reach out to support.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Assistant fails with "Migration Service is in Maintenence Mode" due to expired token

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After running Jira Macro repair, the space templates that contain Jira Macros didn't get updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Confluence Server, create a space with space templates that contain Jira Macros
 # Migrate the space into Confluence Cloud
 # Run Jira Macro Repair

h3. Expected Results
All content that contain Jira Macros should be updated to point to the new Jira link.

h3. Actual Results
The Jira Macros on Space Templates remain pointing to the old Jira link.

h3. Workaround
# Run the following query on Confluence Server to identify the affected templates.
{code}
SELECT t.*
FROM pagetemplates t
JOIN spaces s ON s.spaceid=t.spaceid
where t.content like '%<ac:structured-macro ac:name="jira"%'
{code}
# Then manually updated the macros
fields.summary: Jira Macro Repair Doesn't Update the Jira Macros on Space Templates

fields.description:

Herer's one exampel of what can fail out:

ERROR TS project-import We couldn't import Project

the reasons for the missing dependencies on your server site.
{code}

This usually happens if the instance was migrated from Cloud to the server prior to using the assistant.

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Workaround 

Remove the add-on users from server and trigger a new migration.
fields.summary: Better handle add-on users when migrating

fields.description: Lots of customers use Portfolio for Jira in server, and wouldn't consider migrating to cloud without it. JCMA should also support the migration of Portfolio data to cloud.
fields.summary: Support migrating Advanced Roadmaps (Former Portfolio) for Jira using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk projects on Cloud instances can have custom incoming mailboxes to create tickets. Once a full import from another Cloud instance is made, it will not wipe out the custom mailboxes from the projects and so, both instances will have the same inbox configured, causing the comments from one instance to go to the other.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Jira Cloud instance, configure a custom mailbox in the project settings > email requests;
# Create a backup for Cloud;
# Import on another Jira Cloud instance.

h3. Expected Results

The project's custom mailbox is wiped out during the import.

h3. Actual Results

The custom mailbox is imported along with the project.
 
h3. Notes

A side effect of this bug is that incoming emails can create tickets or comment on existing ones in the wrong instance.

h3.Workaround

After importing from a Cloud instance, access the Email Requests page at https://Your_Instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa and remove all custom mailboxes.
fields.summary: The migration from Cloud to Cloud will not wipe custom incoming mailboxes configured on projects

fields.description:
Currently the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant does not provide specific information about the entities that were migrated. There is a specification here that shows what objects are supported in the migration [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html] however for customers interested in specific objects and object count (eg. a particular board or number of boards) the audit needs to be conducted manually.

It would be great if we got an automatically generated report at the end of the migration with a count of the entities that were migrated.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence cloud migration does not work in IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
I've used an external non-atlassian account and I was not logged in in the browser before I started migration
# Use IE 11 browser
# Start Confluence cloud migration
# Get to "Connect to your cloud site" page
# Hit "Choose cloud site button"
# Login to the account and select the site

h3. Expected Results
Your migration site is selected and you can proceed with the migration

h3. Actual Results
Migration site is not selected. You are redirected back to the "Connect your cloud site" page which offers you to select the site again. You can't proceed further

See attached video.

h3. Workaround
Use another browser
fields.summary: Confluence cloud migration does not work in IE11

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In many scenarios, customers would perform multiple test migration. In case if we had installed an add-on and perform another import, it's impossible to install the same add-on again after the new import.

Background of the bug: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-1528

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a third-party app (like Tempo Timesheet, Zephyr, etc)
 # Perform a site import
 # Once import is done, install the app from Step 1 again

h3. Expected Results
App is installed successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Jira shows error when installing the apps.

h3. Suggestion
Jira should automatically uninstall all third-party apps when clearing Jira's content, before replacing the data from the backup file.

h3. Workaround
* Uninstall all third-party apps before performing the new import.
* Ask the vendor to update their registry and update the baseUrl/clientKey to the new values.
fields.summary: Add-ons break after a site import is performed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When importing a site backup into JIRA Cloud the users may face the following error when synchronizing users and groups:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown by the import service:
{noformat}
ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "uk_user_name_dir_id"
  Detail: Key (lower_user_name, directory_id)=(username, 10000) already exisRunning new test!.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

There's no workaround at the moment but the migration support team can help on resolving this issue, please engage them [here|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
fields.summary: JIRA site import fails when synchronizing users and groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you try to export a project using JCMA, a variation of permission issues happen that makes the migration fail:
  
{code:java}
2020-03-18 14:24:02.262 ERROR TEST3 project-import We couldn't import Rapid View 'TEST3'. Reason: The selected filter is not available to you, perhaps it has been deleted or had its permissions changed..
{code}
{code:java}
2020-03-19 00:57:43.581 ERROR TEST project-import We couldn't import Board 'TEST board'. Reason: The selected filter is not available to you, perhaps it has been deleted or had its permissions changed..{code}
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prepare two admin users A and B

 # Login with user A, then create a filter with JQL like “project = ABC …”. Make the filter private

 # Create a board using the filter under project ABC

 # Login with user B, and migrate the project

(!) Note that there may be other variations that cause this issue.

 
h3. Expected Results
JCMA handles the permission discrepancies

h3. Actual Results
The migration attempt fails

h3. Workaround
 Deleting the board on the source instance and recreating on the destination instance.
fields.summary: Board migration fais when current user cannot access filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating from Server to Cloud, the *Target start* field data from Portfolio is not migrated and this column becomes empty in Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Portfolio Plan with values for the *Target start* field in the Scope view
 # Migrate from Server to Cloud as explained in [Migrate From Jira Server To Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/migrate-from-jira-server-to-jira-cloud-972349848.html]

h3. Expected Results

Just like the *Start date* and *Target due date* fields, the data should be present in Cloud.

h3. Actual Results

The field is empty.
 !target_start.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Target start data is not imported to Portfolio Cloud when migrating

fields.description:
h3. Current challenge:

The [Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant] is checking for group conflicts and if it identifies any it will merge them.  

It will also display a warning:
{quote}If we find a group in your server site that has the same name as a group in your cloud site, we will merge the users from the server group into the cloud group._
{quote}
 

 Additional details from [our public documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-973486571.html]

_"If you have chosen to migrate all users, we will check to see if you have any groups with the same name already in your cloud site. If we find groups with the same name, we will merge the users from the server group into the cloud group with the same name. You can continue with your migration without fixing this issue, but it’s important to check that this won’t cause permission escalation."_
h3. _Suggestion:_

It will be great if the plugin will be able to display and/or to provide the option to export an assessment for the users & groups that will be merged to help understand the impact of this merge.
fields.summary: Merge groups preview to better assess the impact of the merge

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The New [Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/use-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud-993925215.html] does not migrate Remote links such as Confluence link reference, this is an expected behaviour and is mentioned in [What gets migrated with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to migrate Jira Server which has page link such as wiki links on Jira Issues using the [Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/use-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud-993925215.html]

h3. Expected Results

Migrate successfully with the Reference remote links as well
h3. Actual Results

After migration, under the new issue, the Remote links are being missed

*From support.zip logs* you will see the below:
{noformat}
[c.a.j.m.e.core.issue.ChangeGroupExporter$CloudChangeItemConverter] RemoteIssueLink on Issue XXXX-1XX1 is not supported
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Download the latest version of the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant or any version from 1.5.2
 * Enter the URL in your web browser (change Jira_URL below with your Jira server URL):
{code:java}
{Jira_URL}/secure/admin/jira/views/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa{code}

 * Add the Dark feature "com.atlassian.jira.migration.remote-link-migration.feature" and save.
 * Start your migration as usual.

h3. Suggestion

Please migrate the Remote link when Projects are migrated using the [Jira Cloud Migration Assistant.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/use-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud-993925215.html]
fields.summary: Jira Migration Assistant doesn't migrate remote links

fields.description:
In the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, currently all users & groups are migrated. This does not provide the flexibility needed to only migrate a sub-set of users the customer deems is approved or needed to be given product access in Jira Cloud.

It is possible to contact Atlassian Support to ask that we disable the user & group step and perform a manual user & group migration (see this comment). This then allows a migration option where
 # The first migration requires all users & groups to be migrated (end users are not notified of this event).
 # Remove the users and groups not needed in Cloud
 # Disable user & group migration in the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant
 # Migration of projects then only adds project config, issues and attachments. Users and groups remain as per the manual overrides performed in the previous steps.
fields.summary: Only migrate users & groups relevant to the projects I have selected
