fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It would be great to expand the compatible versions of Jira with JCMA to include earlier versions of Jira 7 and Jira 6
h3. Workaround

The only workaround, for now, is to upgrade Jira to be able to use the JCMA tool.
fields.summary: Expand Supported Versions of Jira with JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Migration fails for projects which have filters using old project keys.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Create a board for that project
 # Change the project key
 # Attempt to migrate that project via JCMA

h3. Expected Results

The migration succeeds and the filter works in cloud.
h3. Actual Results

The project migration fails with the following error:
{noformat}
'The value '<old project key>' does not exist for the field 'project'.'
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Edit the filter that is failing and update the key referenced in the filter to the current project key.

Eg: if the filter query is "project = TIS ORDER BY Rank ASC" and the new project key is TIS1, update the filter query to "project = TIS1 ORDER BY Rank ASC".
fields.summary: Filter migration fails with error "The value '<key>' does not exist for the field 'project'"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a board's filter has a share-permission that refers to another board then the export will fail with the following unhelpful error:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board for a project
 # Go to the filter used by that project and share it using the Project option
 # Select another project
 # Attempt to migrate the project via JCMA

h3. Expected Results

The board is migrated correctly and the share permission is retained
h3. Actual Results

Project migration fails with this:
{code:java}
We couldn't export Share Permission XXXX. Reason: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Entity mri:mig:jira/classic:project:XXXX is expected to be exported, but it was not.{code}
 
h3. Workaround

Navigate via Jira UI to the board that is failing migrations and remove the shared-permission referencing another project. Attempt to remigrate project. Add the shared-permission when the referenced project is in Cloud.

!workaround.png|width=256,height=377!
fields.summary: Export failure when Board's filter has Share-Permission that refers to another Project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When issues have null priorities, the project migration fails.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

One way to reproduce this problem is to create a new issue and remove the priority directly from the Jira database. There might be other ways to run into this issue though.
h3. Expected Results

Migration succeeds by assigning a default priority value to issues with missing priority.
h3. Actual Results

The project migration completes with a FAILED status.
h3. Workaround
h4. Option 1
 # Run this JQL
{code:java}
priority is null{code}

 # This will show all issues with missing priority
 # Bulk update the issues to have a priority value.

h4. Option 2
 # Go to the Jira database and assign priorities to all issues with null priorities.
 # Sample SQL to make the change (might not work for all database types):
{noformat}
update jiraissue set priority=2 where id in (select id from jiraissue where priority is null);{noformat}
(make sure to update the priority value accordingly)

h4. Option 3
 # If the project has a priority scheme with default priority enabled. direction as given below.  !Screenshot from 2020-04-07 11-21-20.png|width=490,height=341!
 #  Then, enable this feature flag (*{{com.atlassian.jira.migration.}}{{assign.default.issue.priority)}}* so that JCMA will set the default priority whenever an issue found with null or empty priority.  Please refer to this document [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html] to add feature flags.
fields.summary: Project migration fails when issues have null priority

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Project migration fails when a status that is not part of the project's workflow is mapped to a column in that project's board.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board for a project
 # Map a status that is not part of the project workflow to one of the columns in the board
 # Attempt to migrate the project via JCMA

h3. Expected Results

The board is migrated correctly and the status that doesn't exist in the workflow is ignored/removed from the board.
h3. Actual Results

Project migration fails with an error such as:
{noformat}
We couldn't export Rapid View 'My Board' because the column 'In Progress' refers to missing statuses '10010' & '10011'. Please remove the column OR update it to remove the missing status.{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Navigate via Jira UI to the board that is failing migrations and remove the status that doesn't exist in the project workflow. Attempt to remigrate project.
fields.summary: Can't migrate projects boards when a status that is not part of the workflow is mapped to a column

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At times, project migration doesn't work in the first attempt. This means customers will try to remigrate those projects in a new plan. When creating new plans though there is no easy way to view the latest migration status for each project, making it hard for customers to identify which projects they should select to migrate again.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add the latest migration status of each project to the project selection screen
 * Add a filter option based on project migration status
fields.summary: Filter projects that have failed migration after running a plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira Cloud Migration assistant only supports migrating Jira Software or Jira Core projects, not Jira Service Management projects (formerly Jira Service Desk)
h3. Suggested Solution

The Migration Assistant should support the migration of Jira Service Management projects as well
h3. Workaround

Please use [site export|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/backing-up-data-938847673.html] and [site import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/use-jira-site-import-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud-972349848.html] feature in order to import Jira Service Desk projects to a cloud site.
fields.summary: Support migration of Jira Service Management projects (formally Jira Service Desk)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If my cloud site has a different combination of products than my server site, migrations will fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a cloud site with a different combination of products than your server site (eg: cloud site has JSW, server site has Jcore + JSW)
 # Setup a migration plan and click Run

h3. Expected Results

The migration succeeds.
h3. Actual Results

The migration fails when attempting to migrate users and groups with an error such as:
{noformat}
100:Groups contain permissions for products that do not exist on your cloud site. Enable Jira Core in your cloud site and try again.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Add the same products to the cloud site (free versions are acceptable).
fields.summary: Migrations fail when the products in the destination cloud site don’t match the products on the server site

fields.description:
Right now the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant can only be used in Jira server instances. JCMA should support migrations from Jira DC as well.

*Steps to reproduce:* 
Go to Marketplace and try to download the plugin for Jira Data Center.

*Expected results* 
JCMA can be downloaded and/or installed into a Jira Data Center instance. 

*Actual results*
JCMA is not available for Jira Data Center.
fields.summary: Support for Jira Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After a Site Import on Jira Cloud, *New Issue View* will show borked content if issues have links with special characters on their description field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Jira Server, create an issue.
# Make sure to add an URL in its description field that has special characters on it, such as exclamation marks, for example:
{code}
https://test.alfa.com/logs/delta/dogs#/discover?_g=negate:!f,params:(query:'turuturu',type:phrase),type:phrase,value:'balabala'),query:(match:(message:(query:'yeahyeah',type:phrase)))),('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!f,index:tchurutchuru,key:message,negate:!f,params:(query:'MARS(LOLRUS->Whatever)',type:phrase),type:phrase,value:'SATURN(RERAS->BinaryDecisionOnRule)'),sort:!('@timestamp',desc))
{code}
# These are usually used by reporting tools that have tons of parameters appended to their URLs.
# With the URL added to the description field, go ahead and generate a site export.
# Import that to Cloud.

h3. Expected Results
URL is rendered accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
Exclamation marks in the URL are parsed by the New Issue View as possible reference to attachments and what seems to be missing attachments get displayed - Notice that colons get parsed as emojis too:
!Screen Shot 2020-03-06 at 12.46.39.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
# Switch to the Old Issue View by appending _?oldIssueView=true_ at the end of your issue view URL:
{code}
https://test.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-1?oldIssueView=true
{code}
# Go ahead and copy all the text inside the Description Field (CTRL+C).
# Switch back to New Issue View.
# Delete everything in the Description field.
# Paste what you have previously copied in the Description Field (CTRL+V).
# You will have all the needed content in there (URLs, etc.) but in an unformatted format.
# Go ahead and manually re-apply formatting, such as code boxes, etc.

h3. Extra
This might be happening because Jira uses the exclamation mark to reference attachments. However, the New Issue View shouldn't try to parse URLs to find attachments. Reference:
{code}
!Screen Shot 2020-03-06 at 12.46.39.png|thumbnail!
{code}
fields.summary: Importing Issues with Links that have Special Characters might cause broken references in Jira's New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Cloud Migration Assistant throws an error related to file access on Windows machines
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to run a Jira project migration with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistan

h3. Expected Results

Project is migrated
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the ui:
{noformat}
[Jira Path]\Application Data\JIRA\export\migration-to-cloud\[ID]\projects\[Project Key].json: The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this issue at present, a fix will be released shortly
fields.summary: Local Jira files cannot be deleted on Windows

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now the JIRA Migration assistant only supports migrating projects together with users.
 While this is a needed approach to import data with the correct ownership into Cloud this blocks test migrations where invalid users are present in the server userbase(users with a null email address for example). Those customers need to first clean up the server userbase before being able to use the assistant and test their migration.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option to ignore some or all users so admins can test the migration assistant without needing to clean up any invalid accounts in the server userbase.

OR

Have JCMA figure out which users have no data at all, and which users have no access to Jira, and exclude those users from the set of users to migrate.
fields.summary: Support migrating data without users/groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Confleunce Cloud Migration Assistant(CCMA)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-973486571.html] has the option to import your server Spaces to Cloud containing your users and groups.

Due to how the app code is handling the users invites when you opt to import the Spaces without users/groups the users will still be invited into the default groups from your Cloud instance which might result in the error *"Failed to call to IDP to invite user."* in case the instance has no more seats available for Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Confluence Cloud instance set to annual license or Free license(max 10 users)
 # With CCMA, try to import Spaces from server to Cloud without users. Make sure the users on the on-premise instance will pass the current limit of users in the Cloud.

h3. Expected Results

All the spaces should be imported and the users should be added without any product access.
h3. Actual Results

The import will fail when the user limit license is reached in Cloud due to the bug.

h3. Workaround

For the Spaces that failed, [manually export them|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml-139475.html] from on-premise and [import them|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/import-a-confluence-space-724765531.html] into the Cloud instance.
fields.summary: Cloud space import is not respecting the option to import Spaces without users/groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Migration with Russian name is not displayed correctly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
MS SQL Server database 13.0 (SQL Server 2016) - default version in InstEnv
 # Start a migration task
 # Give it a Russian name like for example "Русская миграция"

h3. Expected Results
The migration should be displayed correctly

h3. Actual Results
Russian characters are replaced with question marks "?????"
 !image-2020-02-28-11-05-54-643.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Migration with Russian name is not displayed correctly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Once a migration plan has been saved it is not possible to delete the plan. This causes problems if a plan was accidentally created and you want to delete it so that it isn't accidentally ran.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide ability to delete saved plans

h3. Workaround 

There is currently no workaround available
fields.summary: Provide ability to delete saved plans in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant doesn't support the migration of Team Calendars and it would require the manual works:
 * [Export Team Calendars Content to Other Calendars|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/export-team-calendars-content-to-other-calendars-240913738.html]
 * [Add other calendars - Import Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/create-add-and-edit-calendars-654213559.html#Create,Add,andEditCalendars-Addothercalendars]

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Support the export/import of Team Calendar data
 * Provide the REST API to bulk export/create the calendars
 * Ability to migrate Team Calendar data using Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant

h3. Why this is important
 * Team Calendar is one of our most used plugins and it could be hundreds or thousands of calendars created within the instance
 * It's not feasible to manually export/import hundreds or thousands of calendars
 * When we perform the migration from Server to Cloud, we are hoping to minimize the data loss after the migration.

h3. Workaround

Use the [team-calendars|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/team-calendars/src/master/] migration script. _Full details are in the README of the script._
_(!) Please note that this is not an officially supported tool/script, so this is intended to be used as is with thorough testing until an official migration method is released_
fields.summary: Support the Migration of Team Calendar for Confluence

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Attachments with the [acute accent|https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%C2%B4] imported from Confluence Server 5.10, are not recognized in Confluence Cloud, being displayed as "Unknown Attachment" on the imported Space. 

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Create a new Space on Confluence Server 5.10
# Create a new page
# Insert an attachment that has the accent on its name (i.e. Capture d’écran)
# Export the space as XML
# Import in Confluence Cloud
# Open the page with the attachment

h3.Expected Behavior
The attachment would be display

h3.Actual Behavior
The attachment is displayed as a block with "Unknown Attachment" inside

h3.Workaround
Re-attach the file, or rename and re-attach it to the page
fields.summary: Attachments with special characters broken after space import to Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating Confluence spaces using the Cloud Migration Assistant if you chose to not migrate the users and groups the group permissions on the spaces will not be carried over for groups that don't exist in the Cloud site.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Confluence Server, create a plan and chose not to migrate users and groups
# Have a space with a set of permissions using custom groups.
# These permissions won't be carried over to the Cloud.

h3. Expected Results

The permissions would be there but would only be valid when you create the corresponding groups.

h3. Actual Results

The space will not have any permissions if the corresponding groups don't exist in the Cloud.

h3. Workaround

Manually create the groups in the cloud with the exact same name, including the casing of the letters to match exactly with what you have on your server.

*Note*

Update this doc to reflect this behavior:

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-973486571.html
fields.summary: Migrate permissions for the spaces even when choosing to not migrate users and groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira import process does not allow + and ' in the email addresses during the validation phase.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test Cloud/Server Jira instance.
# Create a user in the site with email something like abc+xy'z@gmail.com
# Create a backup of this instance.
# Submit this backup in another Jira Cloud site.

h3. Expected Results
Jira importer should not throw errors for emails with + and ' in them.

h3. Actual Results
Jira importer shows a window to correct such emails and remove + and ' from them and if we will skip this part, the import will fail.


h3. Workaround
NA

*+Notes+:*
* + and ' are actually valid aliases/characters for an email address.
* A month ago, Jira import used to accept such emails, this change came into action this month only.
* If the site allows inviting such emails then it should also accept such emails in Jira import validation also.
fields.summary: Jira site import does not allow email addresses with characters like + and ' in the backup file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* In Jira Cloud, the project key must contain only alphanumeric characters and any symbols is not supported.
* In Jira Server, admins can modify the project key pattern and allow the project key to contains '_' underscore value.
** [Changing the project key format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/changing-the-project-key-format-938847081.html]
* When we migrate the data from Jira Server to Jira Cloud, the project key retains with 'underscore' value as in Jira Server. When we use "Import Media" option to upload the attachments, the attachments not working for the projects that contain 'underscore' key.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  On Jira Server, update the configuration to allow 'underscore' value as the project key pattern as per [Changing the project key format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/changing-the-project-key-format-938847081.html]
{code}[A-Z][A-Z_0-9]+{code}
# Create a project with underscore key, eg: U_SCORE
# Export the site and import the data into test Cloud site
# Upload the attachments of U_SCORE

h3. Expected Results
The attachments are updated with the uploaded files.

h3. Actual Results
The attachments remain broken.

h3. Notes
This only happens when you split out the attachments by projects, and upload only a single project that contains 'underscore'.

h3. Workaround
* If you're splitting the attachments upload due to the size of the zip, you must combine the attachments with the other projects, where no underscore value on the project key.
* Example:
## Create another project with letters only project key, eg: TEST (Skip this if you already have another project)
## Export the site and import the data into test Cloud site
## Upload the attachments of U_SCORE and TEST together (don't split them up)
fields.summary: Attachments Upload Doesn't Work When The Project Key Contains Underscore Value

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing data where users have the + (plus sign) on their emails it is failing on the validation process

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup of an instance where you have users with + (plus sign) on their emails
# Use the backup file from step 1 to start an import on a new instance

h3. Expected Results
Per RFC 5322, the plus (+) character is valid for email addresses and the accounts should be created and the import should progress

h3. Actual Results
All the accounts with the + (plus sign) on the emails will be marked as invalid by the import validation process

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Emails with + (plus sign) are failing on the Import validation process

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a migration if there are space shortcuts on the spaces being migrated, these links are not carried over to the target Cloud instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space
# Put several shortcuts in that space
# Migrate the space to the Cloud

h3. Expected Results

Spaces shortcuts are migrated

h3. Actual Results

The shortcuts are not migrated.

No errors on the logs

h3. Workaround

No workaround is available yet.

Getting the shortcuts from Confluence database:

{code}
select * from "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" where "CATEGORY" = 'QUICK';
{code}

OR

{code}
SELECT sl.*, c.title, 
       'https://mycompany.com/spaces/'||s.spacekey||'/pages/'||c.contentid AS "URL"
FROM   content c join spaces s ON c.spaceid = s.spaceid
join "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" sl on sl."DEST_PAGE_ID" = c.contentid
where c.contentid in (select "DEST_PAGE_ID" from "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" where "CATEGORY" = 'QUICK');
{code}
fields.summary: Space shortcuts are not migrated when using the Cloud Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cloud Migration assistant will fail to migrate users in the `confluence-administrators` group for some cloud sites where the `confluence-administrators` group has special sys_admin permissions.

h3. Workaround

Remove all users from the confluence-administrators group in server and try the migration

or

Contact support to get the special permission fixed in your cloud site.

[Contact Support|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Cloud Migration assistant fails to migrate users and groups with msg Failed to add user to groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Both in Jira Server and Cloud, it's possible to configure a "project outgoing email address" in the project's notification scheme. As in Jira Server, users have to configure their own SMTP server to send Jira notifications, no validation is made towards the address set in the notification scheme. However in Jira Cloud, to use a custom email address, users have to verify their domain and add DKIM/SPF records to their DNS.

Recently, the Jira Cloud import is no longer replacing the project's email address with the cloud one, which bypasses the DKIM/SPF validation.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Jira Server, configure a custom email address in the notification scheme.
# Export the XML Backup
# Import on Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results

The project's custom email address is replaced with jira@<site>.atlassian.net

h3. Actual Results

The custom email address is imported over.
 
h3. Notes

A side effect of this bug is that Jira emails will be rejected by remote mail servers, as Atlassian won't have the necessary permissions to send emails on behalf of the custom domain.

h3.Workaround

Validate the domain as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html
fields.summary: The migration to Jira Cloud will not wipe project's custom email address configured on Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Timestamps of attachments are not correctly migrated to the Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence server
# Create content with attachments
# Migrate those spaces to the Cloud
# Check those attachments after the migration.

h3. Expected Results

The timestamps would be correctly imported.

h3. Actual Results

 !Cloud_timestamps2.png|thumbnail! 
 !Server_timestamps2.png|thumbnail! 

 !Cloud_timestamps1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Server_timestamps1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Attachments time stamp date gets shifted when importing using the Cloud Assistant for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

After a Confluence space migration, if there are multiple spaces that have failed to migrate, it would be good to filter those through completed or failed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a filter option for the status MIGRATED or FAILED.

h3. Why this is important

For Enterprise customers, when retrying the spaces that failed, it's difficult to filter through the spaces that were previously failed.

 !Screen Shot 2020-01-17 at 19.33.53.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: It would be great to filter spaces that have failed after running a plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there is a customer in Jira Service Desk Cloud with an invalid email e.g: *@gmail.com, $%@dummy.com users will be unable to perform an import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Cloud instance, subscribe to JSD
# Create a JSD project, create a customer with an invalid email *@gmail.com, $%@dummy.com.
# Create a backup for Cloud
# Import on another Cloud site

h3. Expected Results

Jira Cloud import would catch these invalid emails during validation.

h3. Actual Results

Import fails

 !Screen Shot 2020-01-17 at 16.11.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Remove the accounts on the source instance.

*Note* Our Site import validation should catch these accounts and suggest new emails for those.
fields.summary: JSD customers can be created with invalid emails in the Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Though the marketplace access is disabled, _Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence_ plugin fires a request to marketplace for version check as shown in *Actual Results* part.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Stop Marketplace access, via uncheck *Connect to the Atlassian Marketplace* in _Confluence Administrations_ -> _Manage apps_ - > _Settings_
 # Find *Connect to the Atlassian Marketplace*  in _Manage apps_, disable it.
 # Enable it, a error will happen as described in *Actual Results* party.
 # It can be reproduced as well once the confluence service is restarted.

h3. Expected Results

All the access against Marketplace should not be fired once *Connect to the Atlassian Marketplace* is disabled.
h3. Actual Results

The access attempt is observed in confluence log.
{noformat}
2020-01-10 02:37:31,815 WARN [Caesium-1-1] [impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper] runJob Scheduled job migration-plugin:plugin-version-checker#ace837a4-5e15-4725-b9a1-5a18508df971 completed unsuccessfully with response JobRunnerResponse[runOutcome=FAILED,message='Failed to check plugin version']
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Disable _Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence_ plugin.
fields.summary: Cloud Migration Assistant fire request to marketplace though marketplace is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
From [Importing data from JSON|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-json-776636779.html] document, it mentioned that we can set the status of the users when creating the new users (active: true/false).
{code}
"users": [ 
	{
        "name" : "abcde-12345-fedcba",
        "groups" : [ "jira-users", "my-custom-group" ],
        "active" : true,
        "email" : "user1@example.com",
        "fullname" : "User 1"
	}
]
{code}

However, the users are always get created as active users on User Management even though we set the active status to false. Example:
{code}
"users": [ 
	{
        "name" : "abcde-456789-fedcba",
        "active" : false,
        "email" : "user2@example.com",
        "fullname" : "User 2"
	}
]
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSON file with active and inactive users. Example:
{code}
"users": [ 
	{"name" : "abcde-12345-fedcba","groups" : [ "jira-users", "my-custom-group" ],"active" : true,"email" : "user1@example.com","fullname" : "User 1"},
 	{"name" : "abcde-456789-fedcba","active" : false,"email" : "user2@example.com","fullname" : "User 2"}
]
{code}
# Attempt the import to the site using JSON importer
 !image-2020-01-17-10-29-30-794.png|thumbnail! 
# Set the users to inactive
 !image-2020-01-17-10-29-10-978.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* User 2 is set to *inactive* in User Management

h3. Actual Results
* User 2 is set to *active* in User Management
* User 2 received the invitation email to access the site
* If "New users have access to this product" option is enabled, User 2 is added to the default group(s) as well.
 !image-2020-01-17-10-32-15-918.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Contact Atlassian Support 
* Provide the list of users in CSV file, with the following header sequence:
{code}
email_address,name,fullname,active
user1@example.com,abcde-12345-fedcba,User 1,1
user2@example.com,abcde-456789-fedcba,User 2,0
{code}
** Active = 1 for active users
** Active = 0 for inactive users
* (Optional) To add the user to the groups, provide the list of memberships in CSV file, with the following header sequence:
{code}
group_name,email_address
jira-users,user1@example.com
jira-users,user3@example.com
my-custom-group,user1@example.com
....
{code}
fields.summary: Import Users with JSON Importer, Always Set The User to Active

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Flagging an issue in Jira will indicate it is important and highlight the issue in backlogs, sprints and boards.

The custom field "Flagged" should only have one value `Impediment`, but in some cases a Server instance may have been configured to have other values.

If an issue is flagged, and has a flagged value other than `Impediment` it will not be migrated by the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

See: [Flagging an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/flagging-an-issue-938845533.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira Custom Field admin screen, add options to the Flagged custom field 
 # Add the Flagged field to a screen to allow it to be editable
 # Edit the Flagged value for an edit and select an option other than `Impediment`
 # Migrate these issues through JCMA

h3. Expected Results

Issue will be migrated from Server to Cloud
h3. Actual Results

All issues with an option other than `Impediment` selected for the Flagged field will not be migrated
h3. Workaround

Bulk edit all issues so that the value for the Flagged field is set to Impediment
fields.summary: Flagged Issues with a value other than 'Impediment' are not migrated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After migrating from Confluence Server to Confluence Cloud, there's no way to migrate the data of Questions, unlike Team Calendar that can at least perform the manual export/import.
* [Confluence Questions FAQ|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questionscloud/confluence-questions-faq-738361810.html]
{quote}
*Can I export to/import from Questions for Confluence Server?*
Right now there's no way to export to/import from Questions for Confluence Server. We're really hopeful we'll be able to support migration in future, but we unfortunately can't give any guarantees or timeframes at this point. If and when the situation changes, we'll let you know.

*Can I import questions from another Q&A system?*
We currently don't provide an import or export tool for Questions for Confluence Cloud.
{quote}


h3. Suggested Solution
* Support the export/import of Questions data
* Provide the REST API to bulk export/create the questions

h3. Why this is important
When we perform the migration from Server to Cloud, we are hoping to minimize the data loss after the migration.
fields.summary: Support the Migration of Questions for Confluence
JSD failed upgrade task is causing failure when importing to JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the EAP version of the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, change items that reference deleted users cause an Error to be thrown instead of a warning even though these change items are not needed in the Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Jira Server change the username of a user who is referenced as a reporter of issues in the project you want to migrate
 # Try and migrate the project to Cloud using JCMA

h3. Expected Results

The project will successfully migrate to Cloud with some warnings about users who are not able to be referenced
h3. Actual Results

The migration assistant throws the below error and is unable to migrate the project:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Failed to determine whether it's user key or name for user reference: username_example
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.framework.ExportService.userRef(ExportService.kt:182) [plugin_8496965603073093104_jira-migration-plugin-0.9.13-httpproxy.jar:?]
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.core.issue.ChangeGroupExporter.createUserReferenceChangeItem(ChangeGroupExporter.kt:416) [plugin_8496965603073093104_jira-migration-plugin-0.9.13-httpproxy.jar:?]

h3. Issue Summary

After migrating to cloud, if you are using the new Jira issue view, when you navigate to an issue that has attachments, if the file is not an image, you can see the whole path to the folder where this file is.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

You will only see the file name and click on it to download

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62850].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently When moving Jira and Confluence to a different environment, most of the time in order to test. The new environment has different URLs, which affects the issue link in Jira and page links in Confluence as they rely on application link which has been defined earlier on the older environment.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Confluence links in Jira need to be updated as the new applink is created.
h3. Temporary Resolution

This issue could be solved by taking the steps at [Application Link Issue When Moving Jira and Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/application-link-issue-when-moving-jira-and-confluence-to-different-environment-856843626.html]. However, this may not be applicable to Cloud since a full restore of Confluence is not possible when also Jira is present on the same instance. Therefore the page-ids may be different as well, not only the hostname, and changing only Confluence url in the backup file won't solve the issue.

In this case you contact Atlassian support by logging a request in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] and ask them to apply the workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Confluence links in Jira issues should be updated automatically based on the new applink configurations

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After the migration to Jira Cloud, the Service Desk customers will lose their password due to:
* For Cloud -> Cloud migration, the backup file doesn't contain the password (nopass) as the passwords are stored externally.
* For Server -> migration, the backup contains password but Jira Cloud's using a different password storing method than Jira Server (pkcs5s2) and so the password no longer valid after the migration.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability for admins to trigger bulk sending the password recovery email to the customer accounts.

h3. Why this is important
* Customers would be confused and fail to login with their account after the migration.
* Currently, there's no way for admin to trigger the password reset on the portal only accounts.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk sending password recovery email to the portal-only customers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Jira server, if a sub-task has no parent issue, and you try to import it on the Cloud the import will fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sub-task without a parent.
 # Generate a backup.
 # Try to import on the Cloud.

h3. Expected Results

In this case, the failure is expected as sub-tasks without parent issues are not allowed in Jira Cloud.
h3. Actual Results

Cloud logs can be requested, please, reach out to [support|https://support.atlassian.com/]
{noformat}
cloud.atlassian.provisioning.exception.PermanentProvisioningFailureException: Import task failed: [The upgrade task manager has returned a non-successful result from running the upgrades. Tasks: 100085]
....
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: column "effective_subtask_parent_id" contains null values
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

This query should return any sub-task that is lacking a parent.
{code:java}
select i.id as "child_id", ( p.pkey || '-' || i.issuenum ) as "child_key", it.pname as "child_type", it.pstyle as "child_type_style" from jiraissue i join project p on i.project = p.id join issuetype it on i.issuetype = it.id left join (select destination, source from issuelink where linktype in (select id from issuelinktype where linkname = 'jira_subtask_link') ) t on i.id = t.destination where it.pstyle = 'jira_subtask' and ( t.source not in (select id from jiraissue) or t.source is null) order by child_id desc;
{code}
Once you find the sub-task you can either change the issue type or delete it if it's not important.

[Running an integrity checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-the-database-integrity-checker-938847667.html] can also allow you to know which issue has no parent.
fields.summary: Import fails due to sub-task missing parent

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When migrating Confluence spaces using Cloud Migration Assitant, if you chose not to migrate with users but only the spaces, the Migration Assistant will create the users who have content in the spaces but will create them as active users.

Although, the users can still be active without consuming license seats.

h3. Suggested Solution

Give the option to migrate the users as active or inactive.

h3. Workaround

Contact Support.
fields.summary: Users are created as active when migrating only spaces in Confluence Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Summary

(i) Note that this is mainly an issue when migration is involved.

When a user subscribe to a new Atlassian Cloud instance, the user will be created in the instance under the username *admin*. When migrating the data from one instance to another, this would cause issues' ownership and its history to be transfered to another user who is the instance's creator in the target instance.

During a Jira import, instance's creator(admin) is not replaced or altered.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Subscribe to a new Atlassian Cloud instance - *A*.
 # Create a project and a few issues.
 # Subscribe to another instance using a different Atlassian account - *B*.
 # Export from *A*.
 # Import into *B*.
 # Check the issues created in #2 for its reporter. The reporter has been changed to the user account which created *B*.

h3. Expected result

Instance's creator username follows the username from email address.
h3. Actual result

Instance's creator username is set to *admin* causing the tranferred ownership to be possible.
h3. Workaround

Ensure that the instances' creator is the same Atlassian account user.
fields.summary: User created with admin username when an instance is subscribed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence is getting stuck when stopping plans

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan to migrate some Spaces from Server to Cloud
# After the plan runs for a bit where the Space has already started to be migrated, stop the plan.

h3. Expected Results

The plan will be stopped accordingly.

h3. Actual Results

The plan gets stuck in *stopping* state.

h3. Workaround
Proceed with the steps outlined on [How to fix plans that are stuck and cannot be stopped during migration in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant (CCMA)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-fix-plans-that-are-stuck-and-cannot-be-stopped-during-migration-in-confluence-cloud-migration-assistant-ccma-1095245292.html] in order to enforce the migration plan to stop.
fields.summary: Confluence Migration Assistant is getting stuck when stopping a plan.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes when using the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence to migrate the spaces, the space logo doesn't get migrated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate spaces from Confluence Server to Cloud
 # After the spaces are migrated, check the space icons in the Cloud

h3. Expected Results

All the spaces logos get migrated.

h3. Actual Results

Some of the spaces are missing their logos.

h3. Workaround

Manually set the space icon. On the Cloud space, click on *Space Settings* > On the right side of the screen next to the space logo, click on Edit. Choose an image and click on save.

*Note* I was not able to find any exceptions either in the Cloud site nor in the Confluence Server.
fields.summary: Sometimes the space logo doesn't get migrated when using Cloud Assistant Migration for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes customers migrating to Cloud can get stuck in Jira Service Desk onboarding. This usually happens when you have subscribed to Jira Service Desk but in the import, there is no JSD project, additionally, you can't skip or create a Jira Service Desk project through the onboarding screen.

*Note* for this bug to happen you need to subscribe to JSD, perform an import with no Jira Service Desk projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Restore a backup that doesn't have a JSD project
 # If you access mycloudinstance.atlassian.net/secure/MyJiraHome.jspa or Click on the left-side Jira icon
# You will be stuck in the on-boarding for Jira Service Desk

h3. Expected Results

Click on Skip to not create a new project.

h3. Actual Results

This error gets displayed:

"We couldn't create your project
Something went wrong, please try again."

 !Screen Shot 2019-11-01 at 15.15.18.png|thumbnail! 

In the browser console, tab network > a 400 error gets thrown and in  the response, we can see the following error message.

{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["Avatar with id '10,420' does not exist."],"errors":{}}
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

# In your browser access the following URL: mycloudinstance.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
# Click on "Create Project" > Choose a Jira Service Desk template

After doing this you can delete the project created, and the problem should be fixed for the other users, they should be able to click on "Skip" in the on-boarding and shouldn't need to create a new Jira Service Desk project.

If even after applying the workaround you continue to have problems, please, contact [Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: After migration, users get stuck in the on-board for Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When doing a Jira site migration, the migration might fail, when that happens Jira will lock itself and prevent any interaction until support goes in and lock the application

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a way for customers to self serv when in this situation so they don't need to rely on support.

h3. Workaround

[Contact Support|https://support.atlassian.com/]

*Note* Every time a Jira site import fails, Jira will lock itself to prevent another import to be made, requires support intervention to get unlocked.
fields.summary: After a failed site migration Jira locks itself

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This was noted especially for customers using Confluence Data Center while using Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, your migration plan gets stuck with an error message "We can't communicate with your server".

Most of them have Confluence deployed in a single node, however, this might be a coincidence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Confluence DC
# Install the latest Cloud Migration Assistant 2.3.0
# Try to migrate spaces to a Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

Spaces get migrated.

h3. Actual Results

The plan gets stuck and you will see an error message "We can't communicate with your server"

fields.summary: Cloud Migration Assistant throw an error "We can't communicate with your server"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With AdBlocker - uBlock Origin v1.22.4 installed, CCMA constantly throws a "We can't communicate with your Server" error messages in the user interface.
h3. Environment

Confluence Server to Cloud Migration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install uBlock Origin v1.22.4 on your browser
 # Install CCMA on your Confluence Server Instance
 # Use CCMA to migrate spaces

h3. Expected Results

Able to use CCMA for migrating spaces with no error messages.
h3. Actual Results

CMAC throws the below error:
 !migration assistant error.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

The message is thrown because of blocked requests from the AdBlocker. Although, none of the CCMA features are altered and it remains fully functional.
h3. Workaround

Disable the AdBlocker and use CCMA.
fields.summary: CCMA throws errors with Ad Blocker - uBlock Origin v1.22.4 installed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When importing data in Jira, we have two buttons, import data and import media, however, it would be better for the import media button to be more explicit saying import attachments, this way customers will be certain they need to use that instead of the import data when only importing the attachments.

h3. Suggested Solution

Change the button display text from import media to import attachments, making it clear that it's only to import the attachments.

h3. Workaround

Not Applicable
fields.summary: Change the import media button text to import attachment

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a backup in Jira Server
 # Import backup from Step 1 to a Jira Cloud instance. 

h3. Expected Results
Site Import Validation Completes. 

h3. Actual Results
Site import fails with validation errors about invalid characters in the XML files. 
Some examples are as follows
{code}"There was an error parsing the entities.xml file: An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0xc) was found in the CDATA section."{code}


h3. Workaround
Steps documented on this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/removing-invalid-characters-from-xml-backups-12079.html]

h3. Additional Notes
It would be great if we could include the steps from this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/removing-invalid-characters-from-xml-backups-12079.html] as a part of the Jira Site import.
fields.summary: Jira site import fails with error about invalid characters in the XML

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Importing a space fails with message: Error Step failed, message: Import to cloud failed. Message: low_version_errorWe can't import your file because it's from an old server version. Please use the [Cloud Migration Asssistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-959303217.html] Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence or upgrade your server version to 6.14 or later before retrying.

h3. Environment

Confluence 6.13.0 and lower.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This is difficult to create a page with the invalid character. It is usually due to older versions of Confluence being upgraded. To cause this error a direct database SQL update on the {{content}} table is required. This is not recommended in production systems.

h3. Expected Results

Space gets migrated.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When creating a plan to migrate data from Confluence Server to Cloud through the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant app, when selecting to not migrate users, the app checks and show *all* users that have invalid email suggesting to fix them, even though the app won't migrate all of them.

The users that have content associated with the Spaces that were selected to migrate will then be migrated, and some of these users might have an invalid email address that will eventually cause the Space migration to fail with the error message in the UI with
{code}
Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

When selecting to not migrate users, the app should check for invalid emails only for the users that have content associated with the Spaces that were selected to the migrated.
 This way we will know which users have to be fixed so that we can migrate those Spaces without having to fix all users with invalid emails which for instances with a large number of users might not be a feasible alternative.

h3. Logs

{code}
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: Failed to call to IDP to invite user
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.importEntities(BackupImporter.java:407)

......

Caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: Failed to call to IDP to invite user
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.DefaultXmlImporter.doImport(DefaultXmlImporter.java:101)
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.importEntities(BackupImporter.java:390)

Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.BadRequestException: {"errorType":"InvalidSchema","message":"Invalid email address"}
com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapStatusCodeException(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:706)
com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapInputStream(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:621
com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.makeRequestWithJsonEntityBody(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:606)
com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.inviteUser(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:418)
com.atlassian.confluence.internal.idp.InviteUserIdentityPlatformCommand.run(InviteUserIdentityPlatformCommand.java:32)
com.atlassian.confluence.internal.idp.InviteUserIdentityPlatformCommand.run(InviteUserIdentityPlatformCommand.java:17)
com.netflix.hystrix.HystrixCommand$2.call(HystrixCommand.java:302)
com.netflix.hystrix.HystrixCommand$2.call(HystrixCommand.java:298)
rx.internal.operators.OnSubscribeDefer.call(OnSubscribeDefer.java:46)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Extract the file {{entities.xml}} from the space export and run this command to identify the blank emails and the users.
{code}
xmlstarlet sel --template --match "/hibernate-generic/object[@class='ConfluenceUserImpl'][@package='com.atlassian.confluence.user']" --sort A:T:U "property[@name='email']" --value-of "id[@name='key']" --output "," --value-of "property[@name='lowerName']" --output "," --value-of "property[@name='email']" -nl entities.xml
{code}

*Note:* It only works in Confluence 6.15.X as the email doesn't get exported in lower versions of Confluence server.
fields.summary: Check users with invalid emails only for the selected Spaces to migrate in the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
